item.title: Entelect working in military field
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect recently delivered a design prototype to African Defence Systems (ADS) under very tight deadlines.

item.title: Retail equity system goes live
item.excerpt:encoded: Since mid October 2006, Entelect has been building a Retail Equity System for Standard Bank Corporate and Investment Banking, which went live today.

item.title: Entelect group of companies grows
item.excerpt:encoded: As from 1 October 2007, Entelect Solutions (SA) will be splitting its two business units into stand alone companies, namely Entelect Software (Pty) Ltd and Entelect Placements (Pty) Ltd. This move has been to pave the way for future potential shareholders and to allow the three units to grow independently.

item.title: New MD for Entelect Placements
item.excerpt:encoded: As from 1 October, Entelect Placements will have a new Managing Director, Christopher Comodikes. Christopher takes over from Entelect's founder Dr Charles Pritchard who will be focusing more on the new strategic initiatives of the Entelect Group.

item.title: Entelect launches University recruitment programme
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect is about to embark on a year-end graduate recruitment programme in its bid to employ and position new BSc Comp Science & Engineering and BCom IS graduates in the market.

item.title: Entelect at the core of Standard Bank's online share trading
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software has recently supplied a number of its Senior Software Engineers to assist in driving a variety of strategic projects at Standard Bank's Financial Markets division.

item.title: Formal Microsoft partner certification
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software recently acquired formal recognition as Certified Microsoft Partners.

item.title: Entelect drives internal R&D efforts
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect has always had an appetite for product innovation and development. The Software business in particular has been growing at a steady rate, currently boasting 50+ of the finest software engineers and computer scientists in South Africa, and growing at a rate of aywhere between 3 to 5 people a month.

item.title: Osiris Trading's game portal framework implementation goes live
item.excerpt:encoded: The first implementation of the Game Portal Framework, Mobibuzz Games that Entelect developed for Osiris trading has gone Live.

item.title: Entelect sponsors cycling
item.excerpt:encoded: This month, Entelect signed a 3 year sponsorship deal with Club 100, one of the biggest national cycling clubs in South Africa.

item.title: Entelect working with the Bond Exchange of South Africa
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect recently started working with the Bond Exchange of South Africa, assisting them with their IT applications development and strategic IT project management.

item.title: Entelect drives Nashua Mobile's BI
item.excerpt:encoded: A couple of months ago Entelect upped its development portfolio with Nashua Mobile, whereby it is currently designing, building and maintaining Nashua's Business Intelligence (MIS) system.

item.title: Entelect partners with Investec
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect recently put a team together to assist Investec with core banking systems development. "A vast majority of the systems we have built are financial services related, plus the culture fit between the organisations is eerily similar", says group CEO Charles Pritchard.

item.title: Entelect takes the lead at Discovery Invest
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect has recently taken over the technical lead in delivering a strategic online solution for Discovery Invest.

item.title: Entelect automates Direkshinz
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect recently developed a supplier and product management system for global homeware supplier, Direkshinz.

item.title: Africas biggest walking event supported by Entelect
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect ran the software support contract for this year's 702 Walk the Talk which attracted some 51000 people. This is one of the biggest events of its kind world-wide, beating the London, Boston, New York and Comrades marathons in size.

item.title: Entelect working with SAAB systems
item.excerpt:encoded: Despite the recent downturn in the economy, this month Entelect started working on a strategic software project with SAAB Systems South Africa. The SAAB Group serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions ranging from military defence to civil security.

item.title: Entelect Software awarded Microsoft Gold Partner status
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software has acquired that illustrious Microsoft Gold Partner status. "Although we had the qualifications prior, we felt that formal certification is essential in establishing ourselves as a serious software design and development company," says group CEO Charles Pritchard. "Microsoft offers a value-added marketing channel to its partners and we hope to work closer with them in delivering software solutions across all business areas."

item.title: Entelect active launched: sports management systems
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect has launched a powerful new suite of sports management online products, aimed at giving sporting bodies (national, provincial, clubs and event organisers) the tools to enhance their business processes and run their own affairs. The offering is currently broken into Event and Club Management Systems. "This software is unique in that it gives total control to non technical people to set up their online presence and control all aspects of their workflow through the web - including member or entrant management and CRM, database management, online payments, website content management, customised newsletters and SMS's, and a variety of other front and back-office functions facilities", says group CEO Charles Pritchard. "We empower event organisers and sports administrators with powerful self-managing software to run their own affairs - and cut out the expense of bespoke development and support. We have taken a suite of common functions performed by these entities and built our software to support these industries, with a low cost rental and sponsorship model that enables organisations to make use of software that they otherwise could not afford."

item.title: Entelect achieves in 2009 despite the ecomomic downturn
item.excerpt:encoded: Despite the economic downturn in 2009, the Entelect group experienced strong financial performance for financial year ending March 2010. The primary reason for this is that we slowed down recruitment and focused on optimising the software projects, consulting and resourcing businesses. Operationally we also made great strides with our infrastructure, billing, administration and finance divisions. A substantial investment was made in the software products division, which is now performing well and the foundations are there for rapid growth.

item.title: Entelect gears for growth in 2011
item.excerpt:encoded: Last year was the year of change at Entelect, in particular to accommodate our growth and maturity as a business. We welcome on board our new team of general managers as well as the appointment of Martin Naude to Entelect’s Chief Technology Officer and Shashi Hansjee to Entelect Software’s Managing Director. We are already seeing the benefits of this restructure with an order book that we are battling to keep up with. As before, we are not compromising on quality when it comes to hiring, so will only grow as fast as we can find quality people. Our ethos of providing high quality people and software solutions at competitive pricing continues to deliver results.

item.title: Entelect pioneers Azure Cloud implementation for Liberty
item.excerpt:encoded: After less than a year of development, Entelect Software is preparing for the upcoming launch of the new Liberty Health burn jOules Customer Loyalty Programme. The development and rollout of this programme is a significant step forward for the use of cloud computing in South Africa. Entelect Software used the Microsoft Azure platform for the entire system, including self-service portals for members, partners, intermediaries and administrators.

item.title: Entelect’s July Mini-DevDay a success
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software is proud to announce that their July Mini-DevDay was a resounding success. As a part of the company’s policy of on-going staff education, the Mini-DevDay brings the company’s software developers together to share knowledge and learn from one another.

item.title: Entelect Foundation committed to maths education
item.excerpt:encoded: Less than two months after it was founded in September 2011, the Entelect Foundation is making great strides in its mission to empower South African youth through education. The Foundation will be providing educational resources to community centres, schools and homes.

item.title: Entelect Software launches innovative staff rewards program
item.excerpt:encoded: Recognising staff accomplishments and ensuring that each staff member is rewarded is critical to ensuring retention over the long term. Realising that this is a component of a holistic staff engagement programme, Entelect has launched an innovative online rewards programme “1Up”.

item.title: Training, pizza and beer
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software hosted another successful run of “MiniDevDay” which was held at The Venue in the Melrose Arch precinct, a short walk down Melrose Boulevard from Entelect’s head office. Devday is a mini conference training event consisting of five presentations prepared and presented by Entelect staff to staff and selected clients. The event is held quarterly and always creates a flurry of people submitting proposals, with only then best presentations getting through.

item.title: Exciting times ahead for the Entelect R100k Challenge
item.excerpt:encoded: It’s been a little less than two weeks since the announcement of the Entelect R100K Challenge and already we’ve been overwhelmed by the response. With over 200 entrants and thousands of eyes on the competition, the stage has been set for a nail-biting tournament which sees the country’s brightest minds go neck-a-neck in an epic AI battle for the grand prize of R100 000 and the title of AI Champion!

item.title: Entelect makes high volume, secure EFT online payments possible for business
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software, South Africa’s leading software solutions and consulting company, has released an innovative EFT reconciliation module which uses a combination of artificial intelligence and traditional banking technology for use in e-commerce applications, opening the doors for the majority of South Africans to transact securely online.

item.title: Entelect Foundation goes back to basics
item.excerpt:encoded: Almost a year into the launch of the Entelect Foundation, and after much investigation into potential high impact “tech” projects at schools, Entelect has gone back to basics and is initiating a simple empowerment programme for South Africa’s underprivileged children. The beneficiaries will be underprivileged children of extended community members of our staff, i.e., children who they know of who need schooling support. The programme involves paying for school fees, ancillary support, tutoring and mentorship assistance with homework on Saturday mornings.

item.title: Jaco Cronje banks R100k courtesy of the Entelect R100K Challenge!
item.excerpt:encoded: Last weekend saw the Entelect R100K Challenge finalists battle it out for R100 000.00 in prize money at Africa’s biggest gaming expo, rAge.

item.title: Entelect announces 60% growth at year-end bash
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect’s annual year-end party took place at Riverstone Lodge on Friday 23 November in Muldersdrift. A variety of team-based “Entelect Survivor Games” activities took place in the afternoon, followed by drinks and prize-giving on the terrace and a superb dinner buffet of South African foods. Dancing and festivities progressed at full vigour with the last bus departing in the early hours of the morning!

item.title: Graduate bootcamp raises the bar at Entelect
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect has used its extensive university networks to hire fifteen of the top Computer Science and Engineering graduates in the country. The range of graduates came from UJ, Wits, UKZN, Rhodes and NMMU, and all were in the top 10% of their respective classes. Over December and January, they were all put through a series of training sessions affectionately known as our Development Bootcamp. The Bootcamp comprised of a series of lectures and practical projects designed to teach the graduates not only the basics of software engineering but also the issues facing software engineers in the enterprise development environment.

item.title: Entelect Foundation supporting 45 underprivileged children
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect, through its Foundation programme, is mentoring and financially supporting 45 underprivileged school children this year. Beneficiaries' names were put forward by staff members who know them, thus forming part of the company's extended community. Entelect's commitment is to pay for school fees, books, uniforms and other related education activities until they graduate, taking on new recipients each year as the company grows. Coupled with this a team of 25 Entelect volunteers (and friends) are assisting the children and their parents or guardians on weekends with mentorship support.

item.title: Top honours for Entelect at Microsoft
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect has been selected as a preferred African partner to attend the Microsoft Partner Council. This exclusive "by invitation only" event will be held in Redmond, Washington from 17 to 19 April and has been reserved for 41 Microsoft partner companies worldwide. The schedule includes high powered speakers, private boardroom sessions with top executives, tours of Microsoft’s facilities and introductions to new technologies.

item.title: Entelect R100k finalists named
item.excerpt:encoded: In this iteration of Entelect’s annual R100 000 AI challenge, players competed in a nostalgic battle of the 8-bit classic, Battle City. Each player controlled a team of two tanks, with the objective of defending their own base while destroying their enemies. A range of maps added variety to the mix while the grand prize gave motivation – R100 000 to be awarded to the player who is victorious at the finals to be held at the largest gaming expo in South Africa, the rAge expo.

item.title: Pierre Pretorius wins R100 000!
item.excerpt:encoded: Saturday brought the 2013 Entelect R100K Challenge to a close on the main stage at rAge expo. A fully loaded audience attended the finals which went off superbly under the humorous supervision of Entelect R100K Guru, Evan Knowles. Winner, Pierre Pretorius managed to beat defending 2012 champion, Jaco Cronje in a nail-biting final match.

item.title: Impressive year end growth statistics for Entelect
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect’s year-end party was held on 22 November at Tres Jolie in Rumsig, where fellow colleagues teamed up and built Wendy Houses for underprivileged communities and partied on into the late hours. Evening highlights included the internal R100k play-offs hosted by tech guru Evan Knowles, long service awards by Managing Director, Shashi Hansjee and year-end wrap up speech by CEO Charles Pritchard where he confirmed that over the last year Entelect's staff count grew by 25%, turnover by 50% and profits doubled! Some of the reasons attributed to this success include:

item.title: Jerome Lucas explains on SAfm how employee rewards and recognition drives growth in organisations
item.excerpt:encoded: Jerome Lucas outlines to The Talk Shop SAfm host, Naledi Moleo, how organisations can benefit from the implementation of staff rewards programmes. Enhanced employee recognition and retention is one benefit, while the ability to change behaviour results in direct increases in revenues and profitability.

item.title: Entelect BootCamp graduates are in big demand in South Africa
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect is leading the way in fast-tracking graduate computer scientists, software engineers and analysts into the South African market place. Considering that these are some of the most in-demand skills in the world, it’s a big investment that comes with the associated business and financial risks but is paying off in the long run.

item.title: Coders and gamers get ready for the annual Entelect R100K challenge
item.excerpt:encoded: Entries for the renowned, annual R100K Challenge, presented by Entelect Software, opened today. The Challenge will see coders compete in the ultimate battle to win R100 000 and the honour of taking home the title.

item.title: Entelect R100K Challenge featured on Ballz radio
item.excerpt:encoded: Listen to Mark Beets (GM: Business Development), Tim Kroon (GM: Resourcing) and Rishal Hurbans (Team Lead) discuss Entelect and the R100K Challenge on Ballz Radio (http://www.ballz.co.za/the-business.php) during their business segment.

item.title: Entelect attains CPD validation
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect’s course Understanding Transact SQL, Database Optimisation and Database Design has now been validated by SAIEE for continuous professional development (CPD).

item.title: Entelect DevDayII – 8 August 2014
item.excerpt:encoded: DevDay is Entelect's internal tech conference, which is held three times a year and provides our employees with the opportunity to present technical, conceptual or generally interesting topics.

item.title: Sani2c registrations
item.excerpt:encoded: We apologise for the inconvenience on the Sani2c rush entry MyActive system. The amount of instantaneous traffic for the Adventure race was unprecedented, with three times more volume than previous years, and it literally, caught us off-guard.

item.title: The people’s person
item.excerpt:encoded: Entrepreneur magazine’s Nadine Todd recently interviewed Entelect CEO, Dr Charles Pritchard. The feature, which highlights Entelect’s growth and the company’s path to success, can be found in the August 2014 edition.

item.title: Entelect confirmed as the world's best loyalty practitioners
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Software is proud to congratulate their Chief Technology Officer, Martin Naude, on being crowned overall winner of the most recent Loyalty and Gamification World Championship – LoyaltyGames 2014.

item.title: Martin Naude speaks to TechnologyAdvice.com about the Loyalty Games 2014
item.excerpt:encoded: The Technology Advice podcast is for the professional who is constantly learning, growing and adapting to the changing world of business and technology. Clark Buckner from TechnologyAdvice.com spoke to our CTO and Loyalty Games 2014 winner, Martin Naude, about the games and his experiences in participating.

item.title: 2014 SQLBits
item.excerpt:encoded: SQLBits started with a bang on the Friday morning with one of their famous technical keynotes.

item.title: 2014 Entelect open day for graduates
item.excerpt:encoded: Over the past five years, Entelect has worked on its Graduate Recruitment Programme (GRP) to engage and potentially recruit the top talent from the most prestigious universities in South Africa.

item.title: DevDayII feedback
item.excerpt:encoded: On 8 August 2014, Entelect hosted its internal Tech Conference, DevDayII, at the Protea Hotel, Wanderers. The event is held three times a year, providing employees with the opportunity to present technical, conceptual or generally interesting topics.

item.title: Deloitte confirms that Entelect is the best company to work for in Southern Africa
item.excerpt:encoded: When Entelect Software was founded in 2001, the long-term vision was for Entelect to be the world's best software engineering and solutions company, measured by the value the company delivers to its clients, employees and the greater community. On 16 October 2014, the company took a step closer to realising this vision when Entelect was awarded not one, but three, prestigious awards in the Deloitte Best Company to Work For Survey for the Southern African region.

item.title: About the PASS Summit
item.excerpt:encoded: It’s almost November and so for me, that means it’s conference season again.

item.title: Entelect moves offices
item.excerpt:encoded: At the beginning of October 2014, Entelect moved into new offices. A bigger and better space in the familiar surroundings of Melrose Arch, the move proved to be perfectly timed. Over the years, the company has grown to a staff of more than 200 employees and as such, required more space.

item.title: Entelect ends the year with a 25 per cent growth and announces a new CEO
item.excerpt:encoded: On 21 November 2014, Entelect hosted its year-end celebrations in an all-day event at Askari Game Lodge in the Magaliesberg.

item.title: Entelect’s Technology Accelerator Programme is a huge hit
item.excerpt:encoded: This year was the first year that Entelect’s Technology Accelerator Programme was run. The Programme is a platform for Entelect’s employees to learn and understand new technology, solve problems and create a future product outside of their day-to-day responsibilities.

item.title: A trio of conferences
item.excerpt:encoded: In November, I was fortunate to attend not one, but three, really great conferences: Microsoft’s MVP Summit, SQL in the City, and the annual PASS Summit.

item.title: Query Store – the best thing for performance tuning since Extended Events
item.excerpt:encoded: On the Thursday at the annual PASS Summit, Principal Software Architect on the SQL Server Team, Conor Cunningham, presented a session titled ‘Query Store – A New SQL Query Tuning Feature’.

item.title: ICT vacancies in software development: advice for getting the best graduate jobs
item.excerpt:encoded: Tips for graduates and students to help them align themselves to a potential career in software development include attending recommended universities, studying selected subjects, developing specific skills and understanding what to expect from the industry.

item.title: SQL Europe
item.excerpt:encoded: Having been to SQL conferences in the United States towards the end of last year, during the last week in February, the scenic city of Vienna, Austria, will host an SQLSaturday event and London has its turn in March.

item.title: The 2015 R100K Challenge is out of this world
item.excerpt:encoded: Following the massive success of last year’s competition, the South African coding and gaming community has eagerly anticipated the return of the annual Entelect R100K Challenge, in association with NAG and official product sponsor, Sony Mobile.

item.title: SA companies get creative to attract young ICT talent
item.excerpt:encoded: In today’s technological and data driven economy, information and communication technology (ICT) is now at the forefront of business operations. Regardless of industry or offering, to remain competitive and see their business survive in the digital era, organisations across the globe and here in South Africa, have become increasingly reliant on technology and software solutions.

item.title: SQL Europe conferences
item.excerpt:encoded: March 2015 saw the SQLBits conference return to London and I had two sessions to present there. But first, a side trip to Vienna for its SQLSaturday.

item.title: SQL Saturdays in South Africa
item.excerpt:encoded: September seems to be conference month. It’s the month in which the South African SQL Server usergroups run their SQLSaturday mini conferences, and this year, there are three of them.

item.title: Graduating soon?
item.excerpt:encoded: Every year, Entelect hires about 30 Graduates from universities across South Africa. During this recruitment process, we find many graduates who are confused and often don’t know what to look for when choosing their first job.

item.title: SQL in Seattle
item.excerpt:encoded: To me, late October means one thing: it’s time for back-to-back conferences in Seattle, specifically the PASS Summit and the MVP Summit, with a couple of one-day mini-conferences also tossed in for good measure.

item.title: Deloitte Best Company to Work for Survey 2015
item.excerpt:encoded: Since 2000, companies from Southern Africa have participated in Deloitte’s annual Best Company to Work For survey. Regarded as the leading survey of its kind, employees from companies based in South Africa, Namibia and Botswana complete the survey.

item.title: Entelect's 2016 graduate programme
item.excerpt:encoded: Some of South Africa’s best and brightest engineering and science graduates have joined the top ranking software company in Johannesburg: Entelect Software.

item.title: SQL server conferences, European style
item.excerpt:encoded: For passionate software engineers and developers, there are a series of firsts taking place in Europe this week. In London the first InsideSQL conference will be offering a deep-dive into SQL Server and will be followed by the first ever SQLSaturday to be hosted in Iceland.

item.title: Entelect wins at the 2016 Future of HR awards
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect awarded the Best HR Industry Innovation Using Technology Award at the Annual Future of HR awards

item.title: Educating and empowering the youth starts with us
item.excerpt:encoded: Business has a key role to play in educating and empowering the youth of South Africa. More than supporting young South Africans in educational environments, businesses also need to start training talented people who lack skills and experience for the workplace.

item.title: Girl code event for Women’s month
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect sponsors #GirlCodeHack with Girl Code ZA

item.title: Entelect takes its DevDay to the public
item.excerpt:encoded: The first Dev Day took place in Johannesburg this week, hosted by Entelect Software with keynote speaker, well-known software professional and international software consultant, Robert C. Martin, aka, Uncle Bob.

item.title: Entelect top performer at the 2016 RiskAfrica Regatta
item.excerpt:encoded: This past weekend, Entelect sailed to victory at the RISKAfrica Regatta, aboard the Vulcan race boat.

item.title: TempDB & Query Store at this year’s Pass Summit
item.excerpt:encoded: At this year's Pass Summit, Gail Shaw, will be taking attendees through a deep-dive on TempDB as well as providing insights on Query store.

item.title: Entelect awarded for the third year in Deloitte Best Company Survey
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect is excited to announce it has been awarded a Platinum Seal in the 2016 Deloitte 'Best Company Survey'

item.title: Get Your Kids Excited About Coding!
item.excerpt:encoded: Technology is going to become more integral to the future of our economy, so how can one spark a child’s interest in coding?

item.title: Entelect's Refer A Developer competition sends one lucky winner to Thailand
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect ran its first ever Refer A Developer competition in 2016 and today, announces the winner of a trip for two to Thailand.

item.title: Entelect has identified Phambili IT as a strategic alliance partner.
item.excerpt:encoded: Phambili IT offers complimentary services to the existing Entelect Software and is well positioned to extend out our complete solution approach for our existing and future clients.

item.title: Dev Day 2017
item.excerpt:encoded: Dev Day is an event that allows the engineers, hobbyists, enthusiasts, creatives and innovators among us to demonstrate their personal passion projects. Alongside the projects runs a series of presentation talks on various passion topics, and occasionally, some pretty tough twitter questions

item.title: Ryan Louw wins 2017 Entelect Challenge
item.excerpt:encoded: Colonel Panic' won this year’s Entelect Challenge competition, the finals of which were played out at rAge Expo on 7 October.

item.title: LEGO’s Lars Silberbauer will be keynote speaker at Entelects year-end 2017 speaker series.
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect’s last speaker event of the year will be with Lars Silberbauer, Senior Global Director of social media & video at LEGO Group.

item.title: Four conferences, three cities, two weeks!
item.excerpt:encoded: It’s conference season again, and this time there are multiple events in a two-week period. Firstly, there’s a conference that I never expected to be speaking at. IT/Dev Connections, a technologies conference run by Penton. The conference is being held in San Francisco.

item.title: SQL Saturday
item.excerpt:encoded: On Friday, it’s up to Portland for SQL Saturday Oregon, which is held in the fine city of Vancouver.

item.title: FreeCon in Seattle
item.excerpt:encoded: The third conference is more a workshop than a conference, a small little free event designed for those not going to the PASS Summit’s precon days, running on the Tuesday before PASS Summit starts.

item.title: The finale: PASS Summit
item.excerpt:encoded: And finally, the big one. PASS Summit in Seattle, the largest database-focused conference in the world.

item.title: Entelect’s CEO, Shashi Hansjee, wins IITPSA 2017 and joins a long list of game-changing leaders.
item.excerpt:encoded: Shashi Hansjee, CEO, Entelect Software, awarded the coveted 2017 IT Personality of the Year title by the Institute of Information Technology Professionals South Africa.

item.title: More ‘High Flyers’ recorded at Entelect than ever before
item.excerpt:encoded: For the fourth year in a row, Deloitte has awarded Entelect Software the highest honour achievable (Platinum status) for Achievement in its Best Company Survey. This latest award serves to confirm the continued strength of the organisations’ workplace culture and affirms that Entelect is always striving to enhance the working environment for its people.

item.title: Entelect at Dev Week, San Francisco, USA.
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect Solutions Architect, Rishal Hurbans, recently spoke at Dev Week in San Francisco. Flying the flag for South African developers on an international platform, Rishal was also invited to judge the Hackathon. Here's his round up of the week…

item.title: Expanding to New Zealand
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect grew internationally in 2017, kicking off operations in Wellington, and growing the New Zealand staff complement to over 10 in 2018.

item.title: Entelect to acquire a majority stake in Netherlands - based Fixx iT
item.excerpt:encoded: The acquisition will accelerate Entelect’s global expansion, providing worldwide opportunities to staff and extend the reach of their service offering.

item.title: Create the ultimate A.I Bot!
item.excerpt:encoded: Worms, this years’ Entelect Challenge (https://challenge.entelect.co.za/) launches today. The event will run from the 17th of April, and the finals will take place at Comic Con Africa (@AfricaComicCon) on the 21st September at 11am on the center stage. This year it is being held at the Gallagher Convention Centre.

item.title: Top international HR Awards announces Entelect the 2019 winner
item.excerpt:encoded: Top international HR Awards announces Entelect the 2019 winner

item.title: The 2019 Entelect Challenge University Cup Winners Announced
item.excerpt:encoded: Worms, this years’ Entelect Challenge (https://challenge.entelect.co.za/) finals are almost upon us. The grand finale will yet again take place at Comic Con Africa (@AfricaComicCon). Over 60 000 people are expected to attend, so if you plan on making your way through on the 21st of September, come find us on the centre stage in Hall 5 at the Gallagher Convention Centre at 11am!

item.title: Willie Theron wins the 2019 Entelect Challenge
item.excerpt:encoded: Willie Theron, the founder of CyberDevs, and a web developer by profession was announced as the winner of this year’s Entelect Challenge. The finals were played out at Comic Con Africa on the 21st of September with hundreds of fans supporting.

item.title: DevDay 2019 – hosted in two cities twice a year!
item.excerpt:encoded: DevDay is an in-house technology conference organised, presented and attended by Entelect’s own people where the technologist, inventor, hobbyist, engineer or artist in you can come to the fore. The event is part showcase, part science show, part geek club, part makers club; offering a range of lightning talks on cutting-edge technologies, as well as a variety of interactive exhibition stands where people can discover the latest creative innovations in technology.

item.title: Entelect Appoints Chief Technology Officer
item.excerpt:encoded: JOHANNESBURG, Dec.05, 2019 – Entelect’s CEO, Shashi Hansjee, announced their new CTO, Matthew Butler at the company’s year-end function late last week. Hansjee praised Butler saying, “Butler has been with us for over a decade after joining the company as a graduate in 2009 in the capacity of a Software Engineer. Since then he has had an illustrious career at Entelect, having played an integral part in almost every role in the organisation, from building bespoke software, leading successful teams and eventually becoming part of the broader General Management team.” Hansjee also noted

item.title: 64 top graduates join Entelect in 2020
item.excerpt:encoded: Each year, Entelect takes on some of South Africa’s brightest young university graduates, who join us with a mix of engineering, science and commerce degrees. These graduates participate in the intensive Entelect Graduate Programme for six weeks, aimed at accelerating their careers. This training programme is structured to prepare them for the diverse real-world technology delivery environments, and the critical thinking, teamwork and technical skills required to succeed.

item.title: Google Hash Code and the Entelect Hubs
item.excerpt:encoded: For the past few years, Entelect has supported and participated in Hash Code, Google’s annual coding competition. We set up hubs in our Johannesburg, Pretoria and Cape Town offices, and we have Entelectuals participating in the competition every year. Hash Code is a fun challenge aimed at everyone that is 16 years and older, and is open to engineers at any skill level.

item.title: The 2020 Entelect Challenge Launches
item.excerpt:encoded: Overdrive, this years’ Entelect Challenge (https://challenge.entelect.co.za/) launches today. The event will run from the 19th of March, and the finals will take place at Comic Con Africa (@AfricaComicCon) on the 26th September at 11am on the center stage. This year it is again being held at the Gallagher Convention Centre.

item.title: Entelect’s Tech Accelerator Programme
item.excerpt:encoded: The Entelect Tech Accelerator is a platform for our people to work on pet projects. Pet projects can be anything from incubators to new businesses, social initiatives or even just building something as an excuse to play around with cool new tech!

item.title: 2021 Entelect graduate applications are open after this year’s Boot Camp class graduates
item.excerpt:encoded: After a challenging two months, our current 64 graduates made it through Entelect’s 2020 Boot Camp. This programme has been running at Entelect for several years and was developed to escalate all our graduates’ technical careers. If you are interested in joining Entelect’s 2021 Graduate Programme and being part of our Boot Camp visit https://culture.entelect.co.za/apply-now

item.title: Entelect’s 2020 International DevDay
item.excerpt:encoded: This year, due to unforeseen global circumstances, we have taken our annual internal technology conference online! Every Entelect office across the globe will be at this year’s winter event, and we look forward to having all 750 Entelectuals come together to have some fun while learning from their peers.

item.title: Scott Hanselman speaks at Entelect’s International DevDay
item.excerpt:encoded: This year, due to social distancing requirements, we took our annual internal technology conference online! Every Entelect office across the globe joined in to have some fun while learning from their fellow peers.

item.title: Troy Hunt speaks at Entelect’s global DevDay
item.excerpt:encoded: Entelect hosted its second online internal technology conference for the year – DevDay. We decided to keep it online in order for us to keep our people safe, and because we have been successfully working remotely over the last seven months.
